14#ifndef NS_CLIENT_H
15#define NS_CLIENT_H 1
16
17/*****
18 ***** Module Info
19 *****/
20
21/*! \file
22 * \brief
23 * This module defines two objects, ns_client_t and ns_clientmgr_t.
24 *
25 * An ns_client_t object handles incoming DNS requests from clients
26 * on a given network interface.
27 *
28 * Each ns_client_t object can handle only one TCP connection or UDP
29 * request at a time. Therefore, several ns_client_t objects are
30 * typically created to serve each network interface, e.g., one
31 * for handling TCP requests and a few (one per CPU) for handling
32 * UDP requests.
33 *
34 * Incoming requests are classified as queries, zone transfer
35 * requests, update requests, notify requests, etc, and handed off
36 * to the appropriate request handler. When the request has been
37 * fully handled (which can be much later), the ns_client_t must be
38 * notified of this by calling one of the following functions
39 * exactly once in the context of its task:
40 * \code
41 * ns_client_send() (sending a non-error response)
42 * ns_client_sendraw() (sending a raw response)
43 * ns_client_error() (sending an error response)
44 * ns_client_next() (sending no response)
45 *\endcode
46 * This will release any resources used by the request and
47 * and allow the ns_client_t to listen for the next request.
48 *
49 * A ns_clientmgr_t manages a number of ns_client_t objects.
50 * New ns_client_t objects are created by calling
51 * ns_clientmgr_createclients(). They are destroyed by
52 * destroying their manager.
53 */
54
55/***
56 *** Imports
57 ***/
58
59#include <inttypes.h>
60#include <stdbool.h>
61
62#include <isc/buffer.h>
63#include <isc/magic.h>
64#include <isc/stdtime.h>
65#include <isc/quota.h>
66#include <isc/queue.h>
67#include <isc/platform.h>
68
69#include <dns/db.h>
70#include <dns/ecs.h>
71#include <dns/fixedname.h>
72#include <dns/name.h>
73#include <dns/rdataclass.h>
74#include <dns/rdatatype.h>
75#include <dns/tcpmsg.h>
76#include <dns/types.h>
77
78#include <ns/query.h>
79#include <ns/types.h>
80
81/***
82 *** Types
83 ***/
84
85/*% reference-counted TCP connection object */
86typedef struct ns_tcpconn {
87 isc_refcount_t refs;
88 isc_quota_t *tcpquota;
89 bool pipelined;
90} ns_tcpconn_t;
91
92/*% nameserver client structure */
93struct ns_client {
94 unsigned int magic;
95 isc_mem_t *mctx;
96 ns_server_t *sctx;
97 ns_clientmgr_t *manager;
98 int state;
99 int newstate;
100 int naccepts;
101 int nreads;
102 int nsends;
103 int nrecvs;
104 int nupdates;
105 int nctls;
106 int references;
107 bool tcpactive;
108 bool needshutdown; /*
109 * Used by clienttest to get
110 * the client to go from
111 * inactive to free state
112 * by shutting down the
113 * client's task.
114 */
115 unsigned int attributes;
116 isc_task_t *task;
117 dns_view_t *view;
118 dns_dispatch_t *dispatch;
119 isc_socket_t *udpsocket;
120 isc_socket_t *tcplistener;
121 isc_socket_t *tcpsocket;
122 unsigned char *tcpbuf;
123 dns_tcpmsg_t tcpmsg;
124 bool tcpmsg_valid;
125 isc_timer_t *timer;
126 isc_timer_t *delaytimer;
127 bool timerset;
128 dns_message_t *message;
129 isc_socketevent_t *sendevent;
130 isc_socketevent_t *recvevent;
131 unsigned char *recvbuf;
132 dns_rdataset_t *opt;
133 uint16_t udpsize;
134 uint16_t extflags;
135 int16_t ednsversion; /* -1 noedns */
136 void (*next)(ns_client_t *);
137 void (*shutdown)(void *arg, isc_result_t result);
138 void *shutdown_arg;
139 ns_query_t query;
140 isc_time_t requesttime;
141 isc_stdtime_t now;
142 isc_time_t tnow;
143 dns_name_t signername; /*%< [T]SIG key name */
144 dns_name_t *signer; /*%< NULL if not valid sig */
145 bool mortal; /*%< Die after handling request */
146 ns_tcpconn_t *tcpconn;
147 isc_quota_t *recursionquota;
148 ns_interface_t *interface;
149
150 isc_sockaddr_t peeraddr;
151 bool peeraddr_valid;
152 isc_netaddr_t destaddr;
153 isc_sockaddr_t destsockaddr;
154
155 dns_ecs_t ecs; /*%< EDNS client subnet sent by client */
156
157 struct in6_pktinfo pktinfo;
158 isc_dscp_t dscp;
159 isc_event_t ctlevent;
160 /*%
161 * Information about recent FORMERR response(s), for
162 * FORMERR loop avoidance. This is separate for each
163 * client object rather than global only to avoid
164 * the need for locking.
165 */
166 struct {
167 isc_sockaddr_t addr;
168 isc_stdtime_t time;
169 dns_messageid_t id;
170 } formerrcache;
171
172 /*% Callback function to send a response when unit testing */
173 void (*sendcb)(isc_buffer_t *buf);
174
175 ISC_LINK(ns_client_t) link;
176 ISC_LINK(ns_client_t) rlink;
177 ISC_QLINK(ns_client_t) ilink;
178 unsigned char cookie[8];
179 uint32_t expire;
180 unsigned char *keytag;
181 uint16_t keytag_len;
182};
183
184typedef ISC_QUEUE(ns_client_t) client_queue_t;
185typedef ISC_LIST(ns_client_t) client_list_t;
186
187#define NS_CLIENT_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('N','S','C','c')
188#define NS_CLIENT_VALID(c) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(c, NS_CLIENT_MAGIC)
189
190#define NS_CLIENTATTR_TCP 0x00001
191#define NS_CLIENTATTR_RA 0x00002 /*%< Client gets recursive service */
192#define NS_CLIENTATTR_PKTINFO 0x00004 /*%< pktinfo is valid */
193#define NS_CLIENTATTR_MULTICAST 0x00008 /*%< recv'd from multicast */
194#define NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTDNSSEC 0x00010 /*%< include dnssec records */
195#define NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTNSID 0x00020 /*%< include nameserver ID */
196/* Obsolete: NS_CLIENTATTR_FILTER_AAAA 0x00040 */
197/* Obsolete: NS_CLIENTATTR_FILTER_AAAA_RC 0x00080 */
198#define NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTAD 0x00100 /*%< want AD in response if possible */
199#define NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTCOOKIE 0x00200 /*%< return a COOKIE */
200#define NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVECOOKIE 0x00400 /*%< has a valid COOKIE */
201#define NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTEXPIRE 0x00800 /*%< return seconds to expire */
202#define NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVEEXPIRE 0x01000 /*%< return seconds to expire */
203#define NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTOPT 0x02000 /*%< add opt to reply */
204#define NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVEECS 0x04000 /*%< received an ECS option */
205#define NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTPAD 0x08000 /*%< pad reply */
206#define NS_CLIENTATTR_USEKEEPALIVE 0x10000 /*%< use TCP keepalive */
207
208#define NS_CLIENTATTR_NOSETFC 0x20000 /*%< don't set servfail cache */
209
210/*
211 * Flag to use with the SERVFAIL cache to indicate
212 * that a query had the CD bit set.
213 */
214#define NS_FAILCACHE_CD 0x01
215
216LIBNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern unsigned int ns_client_requests;
217
218/***
219 *** Functions
220 ***/
221
222/*
223 * Note! These ns_client_ routines MUST be called ONLY from the client's
224 * task in order to ensure synchronization.
225 */
226
227void
228ns_client_send(ns_client_t *client);
229/*%<
230 * Finish processing the current client request and
231 * send client->message as a response.
232 * \brief
233 * Note! These ns_client_ routines MUST be called ONLY from the client's
234 * task in order to ensure synchronization.
235 */
236
237void
238ns_client_sendraw(ns_client_t *client, dns_message_t *msg);
239/*%<
240 * Finish processing the current client request and
241 * send msg as a response using client->message->id for the id.
242 */
243
244void
245ns_client_error(ns_client_t *client, isc_result_t result);
246/*%<
247 * Finish processing the current client request and return
248 * an error response to the client. The error response
249 * will have an RCODE determined by 'result'.
250 */
251
252void
253ns_client_next(ns_client_t *client, isc_result_t result);
254/*%<
255 * Finish processing the current client request,
256 * return no response to the client.
257 */
258
259bool
260ns_client_shuttingdown(ns_client_t *client);
261/*%<
262 * Return true iff the client is currently shutting down.
263 */
264
265void
266ns_client_attach(ns_client_t *source, ns_client_t **target);
267/*%<
268 * Attach '*targetp' to 'source'.
269 */
270
271void
272ns_client_detach(ns_client_t **clientp);
273/*%<
274 * Detach '*clientp' from its client.
275 */
276
277isc_result_t
278ns_client_replace(ns_client_t *client);
279/*%<
280 * Try to replace the current client with a new one, so that the
281 * current one can go off and do some lengthy work without
282 * leaving the dispatch/socket without service.
283 */
284
285void
286ns_client_settimeout(ns_client_t *client, unsigned int seconds);
287/*%<
288 * Set a timer in the client to go off in the specified amount of time.
289 */
290
291isc_result_t
292ns_clientmgr_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, ns_server_t *sctx, isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr,
293 isc_timermgr_t *timermgr, ns_clientmgr_t **managerp);
294/*%<
295 * Create a client manager.
296 */
297
298void
299ns_clientmgr_destroy(ns_clientmgr_t **managerp);
300/*%<
301 * Destroy a client manager and all ns_client_t objects
302 * managed by it.
303 */
304
305isc_result_t
306ns_clientmgr_createclients(ns_clientmgr_t *manager, unsigned int n,
307 ns_interface_t *ifp, bool tcp);
308/*%<
309 * Create up to 'n' clients listening on interface 'ifp'.
310 * If 'tcp' is true, the clients will listen for TCP connections,
311 * otherwise for UDP requests.
312 */
313
314isc_sockaddr_t *
315ns_client_getsockaddr(ns_client_t *client);
316/*%<
317 * Get the socket address of the client whose request is
318 * currently being processed.
319 */
320
321isc_sockaddr_t *
322ns_client_getdestaddr(ns_client_t *client);
323/*%<
324 * Get the destination address (server) for the request that is
325 * currently being processed.
326 */
327
328isc_result_t
329ns_client_checkaclsilent(ns_client_t *client, isc_netaddr_t *netaddr,
330 dns_acl_t *acl, bool default_allow);
331
332/*%<
333 * Convenience function for client request ACL checking.
334 *
335 * Check the current client request against 'acl'. If 'acl'
336 * is NULL, allow the request iff 'default_allow' is true.
337 * If netaddr is NULL, check the ACL against client->peeraddr;
338 * otherwise check it against netaddr.
339 *
340 * Notes:
341 *\li This is appropriate for checking allow-update,
342 * allow-query, allow-transfer, etc. It is not appropriate
343 * for checking the blackhole list because we treat positive
344 * matches as "allow" and negative matches as "deny"; in
345 * the case of the blackhole list this would be backwards.
346 *
347 * Requires:
348 *\li 'client' points to a valid client.
349 *\li 'netaddr' points to a valid address, or is NULL.
350 *\li 'acl' points to a valid ACL, or is NULL.
351 *
352 * Returns:
353 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS if the request should be allowed
354 * \li DNS_R_REFUSED if the request should be denied
355 *\li No other return values are possible.
356 */
357
358isc_result_t
359ns_client_checkacl(ns_client_t *client,
360 isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr,
361 const char *opname, dns_acl_t *acl,
362 bool default_allow,
363 int log_level);
364/*%<
365 * Like ns_client_checkaclsilent, except the outcome of the check is
366 * logged at log level 'log_level' if denied, and at debug 3 if approved.
367 * Log messages will refer to the request as an 'opname' request.
368 *
369 * Requires:
370 *\li 'client' points to a valid client.
371 *\li 'sockaddr' points to a valid address, or is NULL.
372 *\li 'acl' points to a valid ACL, or is NULL.
373 *\li 'opname' points to a null-terminated string.
374 */
375
376void
377ns_client_log(ns_client_t *client, isc_logcategory_t *category,
378 isc_logmodule_t *module, int level,
379 const char *fmt, ...) ISC_FORMAT_PRINTF(5, 6);
380
381void
382ns_client_logv(ns_client_t *client, isc_logcategory_t *category,
383 isc_logmodule_t *module, int level, const char *fmt, va_list ap) ISC_FORMAT_PRINTF(5, 0);
384
385void
386ns_client_aclmsg(const char *msg, const dns_name_t *name, dns_rdatatype_t type,
387 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass, char *buf, size_t len);
388
389#define NS_CLIENT_ACLMSGSIZE(x) \
390 (DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE + DNS_RDATATYPE_FORMATSIZE + \
391 DNS_RDATACLASS_FORMATSIZE + sizeof(x) + sizeof("'/'"))
392
393void
394ns_client_recursing(ns_client_t *client);
395/*%<
396 * Add client to end of th recursing list.
397 */
398
399void
400ns_client_killoldestquery(ns_client_t *client);
401/*%<
402 * Kill the oldest recursive query (recursing list head).
403 */
404
405void
406ns_client_dumprecursing(FILE *f, ns_clientmgr_t *manager);
407/*%<
408 * Dump the outstanding recursive queries to 'f'.
409 */
410
411void
412ns_client_qnamereplace(ns_client_t *client, dns_name_t *name);
413/*%<
414 * Replace the qname.
415 */
416
417isc_result_t
418ns_client_sourceip(dns_clientinfo_t *ci, isc_sockaddr_t **addrp);
419
420isc_result_t
421ns_client_addopt(ns_client_t *client, dns_message_t *message,
422 dns_rdataset_t **opt);
423
424isc_result_t
425ns__clientmgr_getclient(ns_clientmgr_t *manager, ns_interface_t *ifp,
426 bool tcp, ns_client_t **clientp);
427/*
428 * Get a client object from the inactive queue, or create one, as needed.
429 * (Not intended for use outside this module and associated tests.)
430 */
431
432void
433ns__client_request(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event);
434/*
435 * Handle client requests.
436 * (Not intended for use outside this module and associated tests.)
437 */
438
439dns_rdataset_t *
440ns_client_newrdataset(ns_client_t *client);
441
442void
443ns_client_putrdataset(ns_client_t *client, dns_rdataset_t **rdatasetp);
444/*%<
445 * Get and release temporary rdatasets in the client message;
446 * used in query.c and in plugins.
447 */
448
449isc_result_t
450ns_client_newnamebuf(ns_client_t *client);
451/*%<
452 * Allocate a name buffer for the client message.
453 */
454
455dns_name_t *
456ns_client_newname(ns_client_t *client, isc_buffer_t *dbuf, isc_buffer_t *nbuf);
457/*%<
458 * Get a temporary name for the client message.
459 */
460
461isc_buffer_t *
462ns_client_getnamebuf(ns_client_t *client);
463/*%<
464 * Get a name buffer from the pool, or allocate a new one if needed.
465 */
466
467void
468ns_client_keepname(ns_client_t *client, dns_name_t *name, isc_buffer_t *dbuf);
469/*%<
470 * Adjust buffer 'dbuf' to reflect that 'name' is using space in it,
471 * and set client attributes appropriately.
472 */
473
474void
475ns_client_releasename(ns_client_t *client, dns_name_t **namep);
476/*%<
477 * Release 'name' back to the pool of temporary names for the client
478 * message. If it is using a name buffer, relinquish its exclusive
479 * rights on the buffer.
480 */
481
482isc_result_t
483ns_client_newdbversion(ns_client_t *client, unsigned int n);
484/*%<
485 * Allocate 'n' new database versions for use by client queries.
486 */
487
488ns_dbversion_t *
489ns_client_getdbversion(ns_client_t *client);
490/*%<
491 * Get a free database version for use by a client query, allocating
492 * a new one if necessary.
493 */
494
495ns_dbversion_t *
496ns_client_findversion(ns_client_t *client, dns_db_t *db);
497/*%<
498 * Find the correct database version to use with a client query.
499 * If we have already done a query related to the database 'db',
500 * make sure subsequent queries are from the same version;
501 * otherwise, take a database version from the list of dbversions
502 * allocated by ns_client_newdbversion().
503 */
504
505#endif /* NS_CLIENT_H */
